I'm char

I'm an engineer. I'm a contortionist. I'm a plant enthusiast. I got a lot of little projects all over the place. I like to do all my favorite things always.

About Me

Worked as an epitaxy engineer. Ran away to join the circus. Wanted to find a certain kind of mental stimulation and found myself in software. Juggles complaints from housemates about "too many plants" -whatever that means. Went to UIUC. Aloft. Flatiron. I'm a sort of forever-student.

I'm in Chicago. I'm so sleepy very often.

Resume and Skills

  • Backend and Frontend experience
  • Variety of languages
  • Working with APIs
  • javascript, ruby, rails, react
  • History with python, matlab, java
  • SQL, Excel experience

Projects

Here are some projects I've done recently. Some from flatiron, some personal projects. While they were done for learning purposes, I thought I did some rather meaningful projects that left me feeling motivated

Six Clicks

A wikirace style game that I've put on Heroku. Goals of the project included

  • Create a React App
  • Use Redux
  • Understand stateless components
  • make use of react-router and proper RESTful routing
  • Redux middleware, redux-thunk
  • Interact with a rails API

Pummel

Whack-a-hole but with monsters! It's cute.

  • Integrate JavaScript and Rails
  • All interactions between the client and the server must be handled asynchronously (AJAX) and use JSON as the communication format.
  • The JavaScript application must use Object Oriented JavaScript (classes) to encapsulate related data and behavior
  • The domain model served by the Rails backend must include a resource with at least one has-many relationship

trivichar

Collaborative trivia app. Make and take trivia questions and organize them in rounds to make public for people to play. The Rails project is a great chance for you to show off everything youâ€™ve learned about Ruby on Rails, MVC architecture, data modeling and so much more!

  • Use the Ruby on Rails framework
  • Understand validations to defend against invalid data
  • Scope methods
  • user authentication
  • include and make use of a nested resource with the appropriate RESTful URLs

flishflash

Sinatra Flashcard app

  • Build an MVC Sinatra application
  • Use Active Record
  • Multiple models and relationships
  • Must have user accounts - users must be able to sign up, sign in, and sign out. Validate user uniqueness
  • a user must have the ability to create, read, update and destroy their own resources
  • Ensure that users can edit and delete only their own resources - not resources created by other users
  • Validate user input so bad data cannot be persisted to the database

purkamyern

Pokemon Api to make a simple pseudo pokedex. Not deployed but this is a video walkthru and the github repo

  • Build a CLI
  • Access Data from an external source
  • Use Ruby

circuschar

This was my thing! my circus page! I made it with a bootstrap template. I started working on it before really learning any javascript. Emphasize what I did do - like having the understand how the author wrote the code. What to change where, and how to make the little edits for things that weren't readily available.
